ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating web tasks, integrating applications without APIs, extracting data, and testing web applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Vision-based browser navigation using natural language â€¢ Precise interaction with web elements using mouse and keyboard â€¢ Intelligent data extraction from web pages â€¢ Built-in test runner with visual assertions
ðŸ“– Summary: Magnitude is an open-source, vision-first browser agent that uses AI to enable control of browsers with natural language. It allows users to navigate, interact with, and extract data from web interfaces, and includes a built-in test runner. It can be used for automating tasks, integrating apps, extracting data, and testing web apps.

ðŸ’¡ social-poster | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated posting to multiple social media platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multi-platform posting â€¢ Auto recording â€¢ AI-powered content generation â€¢ Browser-based authentication â€¢ Session management
ðŸ“– Summary: The Social Poster is a CLI tool designed to automate social media posting across various platforms like X, TikTok, and LinkedIn. It uses Puppeteer for browser-based authentication, bypassing API restrictions, and offers features like AI-powered content generation, session management, and dry-run mode for previewing posts. The tool supports text, links, images, and videos, enabling users to efficiently manage their social media presence.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ LMOps | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Enabling AI capabilities with Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI models.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic Prompt Optimization â€¢ Extensible Prompts â€¢ Structured Prompting for Longer Context â€¢ LLM Alignment â€¢ LLM Acceleration for Faster Inference
ðŸ“– Summary: LMOps is a research initiative focused on building AI products with foundation models. It provides technologies for prompt optimization, handling longer context, LLM alignment, faster inference, and customization. The repository aims to advance the development and deployment of AI capabilities using LLMs.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ instill-core | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Building versatile AI-first applications by streamlining data, model, and pipeline orchestration.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ ETL processing â€¢ AI-readiness â€¢ Open-source LLM hosting â€¢ RAG capabilities â€¢ Data orchestration
ðŸ“– Summary: Instill Core is a full-stack AI infrastructure tool designed to streamline the development of AI-first applications. It offers a complete unstructured data solution, including ETL processing, AI-readiness, open-source LLM hosting, and RAG capabilities. The platform focuses on orchestrating data, models, and pipelines to simplify AI application development.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ redka | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Embedded cache for Go applications using SQLite or PostgreSQL.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Redis API compatibility with SQL backend â€¢ Data persistence beyond RAM limits â€¢ ACID transaction support â€¢ SQL views for data analysis â€¢ SQLite and PostgreSQL backend options
ðŸ“– Summary: Redka is a Redis reimplementation that uses SQL as its underlying data store, offering persistence and ACID transactions. It can be used as an embedded cache in Go applications or as a standalone server, supporting both SQLite and PostgreSQL backends. Redka aims to provide Redis-like data structures with the benefits of a relational database.
